visualization_prompt: Generate an interactive map visualization showing geospatial distribution of traffic accidents in Norway during July 2015 categorized by speed limits, using Highmaps with timeline controls and dynamic data updates.

title.text: Traffic Accidents in Norway (July 2015) by Speed Limit

subtitle.text: Interactive timeline with accident density by speed zone

accessibility.description: Dynamic map showing 1,234 synthetic accident records across speed limits 30-100 km/h with temporal distribution patterns

visualization_explanation: The dataset contains geospatial points (latitude/longitude coordinates) with temporal attributes across 8 speed limit categories. Synthetic data was generated with realistic geographic clustering (μ=59.9°N, σ=3.5° latitude) and temporal distribution matching summer traffic patterns. The choropleth map maximizes data-ink ratio by using minimal basemap detail while maintaining geographic context. Color saturation (red markers) follows Cairo's preattentive processing principles for immediate visual salience. Timeline interaction implements progressive disclosure to prevent cognitive overload. Statistical anchors: Coordinate std dev ±2.8° maintains regional accuracy while avoiding real-world collision privacy concerns.
